data.title: Reconstitution of sentence
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.
t=list()
n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    t.append(input())
v=t[0]

while len(t)!=1:
    x=0
    for i in t:
        if i.split()[-1]==v.split()[0]:
            v=i.split(v.split()[0])[0]+v
            t.pop(x)
        elif i.split()[0]==v.split()[-1]:
            v+=i.split(v.split()[-1])[1]
            t.pop(x)
        x+=1
print(v)
data.statement:
You need to reconstruct a sentence by concatenating various inputs. To do so, you need to use this rule : 
If the end of an input i1 is equal to the beginning of an input i2, it means that i2 follows i1. 

Example : 
i1 : "You need to"
i2 : "to wash the car"

Obviously, you will have to remove the extra occurence (in the example case, the word "to")

data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 10
0 < [[row]] < 255
It is guaranteed that a solution always exists and that it is unique.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to reconstruct a sentence by concatenating various inputs. To do so, you need to use this rule :
If the end of an input i1 is equal to the beginning of an input i2, it means that i2 follows i1.

Example :
i1 : "You need to"
i2 : "to wash the car"

Obviously, you will have to remove the extra occurence (in the example case, the word "to")
Input
Line1 : An integer n number of row.
n next lines : A string row to reconstitute.
Output
Line1 : The reconstituted sentence.
Constraints
0 ≤ n ≤ 10
0 < row < 255
It is guaranteed that a solution always exists and that it is unique.
Example
Input
2
va et toi.
Salut ca va
Output
Salut ca va et toi.
